channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 美国国会山的一名助手曾吹嘘自己向乌克兰运送过军事装备，国会将对他是否 "被外国情报机构利用 "进行调查。
item.description:
A Capitol Hill aide who boasted that he delivered military gear to Ukraine faces a congressional inquiry into whether he was being “exploited by a foreign intelligence entity.” https://t.co/i6CXkMZrfB

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 欧洲领导人将齐聚巴黎，试图展示他们支持乌克兰的团结和决心。
item.description:
European leaders are set to gather in Paris in an attempt to showcase unity and resolve in their support for Ukraine. https://t.co/wruTCp3LYa

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯军队仍然比乌克兰军队更愿意承受兵力和装备上的巨大损失，即使是为了取得微小的战果。
item.description:
Russia’s military is still far more willing than Ukraine’s to absorb big losses in troops and equipment, even to make small gains. https://t.co/bWSoqeh0XG

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 克里姆林宫周二警告说，北约在乌克兰当地驻军将不可避免地导致俄罗斯与西方军事联盟之间的直接对抗。
item.description:
The Kremlin warned on Tuesday that NATO troops on the ground in Ukraine would inevitably lead to a direct confrontation between Russia and the Western military alliance. https://t.co/KCFLab4uYp

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 西班牙巴伦西亚地区政府领导人宣布，在一栋高层住宅发生火灾造成至少四人死亡后，将举行为期三天的哀悼活动。
item.description:
The leader of the regional government in Valencia, Spain, announced a three-day period of mourning after a fire in a high-rise residential building killed at least four people. https://t.co/CPWTCQ3nmO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 东欧国家白俄罗斯周日提供了一种民主不可预测性的替代方案：在议会选举中，没有一名候选人批评该国的专制领导人。
item.description:
The East European nation of Belarus on Sunday offered an alternative to the unpredictability of democracy: a vote for Parliament without a single candidate critical of the country’s despotic leader. https://t.co/1qFjVr7Dsg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 去年，数百名美国儿童因肉桂味苹果酱袋中含有高剂量的铅而中毒。纽约时报》和 @examinationnews 获得的记录显示，这些污染是如何一次又一次地被忽视。
item.description:
Hundreds of American children were poisoned last year by cinnamon-flavored applesauce pouches containing high doses of lead. Records obtained by The New York Times and @examinationnews show how, time and again, the contamination went unnoticed. https://t.co/2IRw6Q8a3Y

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 北约的扩张--芬兰去年加入，瑞典不久也将加入--是俄罗斯入侵乌克兰的反击，而俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普尔廷可能没有预料到这一点。
item.description:
NATO’s expansion, with Finland’s joining last year and soon Sweden, is a blowback from Russia’s invasion of Ukraine that President Vladimir Pultin may not have calculated. https://t.co/6KOJVZrkN2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 加拿大扩大了对 2022 年北京奥运会花样滑冰团体奖牌的争夺。加拿大要求获得铜牌，认为国际滑冰官员在剥夺俄罗斯的金牌时计算错误。通过 @tariqpanja：
item.description:
Canada extended the fight over the team figure skating medals from the 2022 Beijing Olympics. It is demanding the bronze, arguing that international skating officials got the math wrong when they stripped Russia of the gold. Via @tariqpanja: https://t.co/D9ZX0lrD3m

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 德国头号通缉犯之一在柏林过着隐姓埋名的生活，距离政府所在地仅数英里之遥。
item.description:
One of Germany’s most wanted fugitives was living in plain sight in Berlin, just miles from the seat of government that the police say she fought to overthrow in the 1990s https://t.co/EqRmOLB4Ag

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 28, 2024

item.title: 红军逃犯达妮埃拉-克莱特（Daniela Klette）在逃亡数十年后在德国被捕。
item.description:
A Red Army Faction fugitive, Daniela Klette, has been arrested in Germany after decades on the run. https://t.co/MV3RddC2Ak

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 本月，一对经验丰富的美国水手夫妇从弗吉尼亚州出发，在加勒比海度过冬季巡航，在格林纳达附近海域航行时失踪，他们的船在邻近的圣文森特岛空无一人。
item.description:
A couple of experienced American sailors who had departed from Virginia and were spending the winter cruising in the Caribbean went missing this month while sailing off Grenada, and their boat turned up empty in the neighboring island of St. Vincent. https://t.co/iFEE0VMOYY

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 在与俄罗斯支持的分离主义分子爆发冲突十年后，在莫斯科全面入侵两年后，乌克兰人疲惫不堪，但始终决心击退入侵者。
item.description:
Diez años después de que estallara el conflicto con los separatistas apoyados por Rusia y dos años después de la invasión a gran escala de Moscú, los ucranianos están cansados pero siempre decididos a repeler a los invasores. https://t.co/NflkdmwxmK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 在花样滑冰管理机构修改 2022 年冬奥会团体比赛结果近一个月后，周一又爆发了一场新的争论。
item.description:
Nearly a month after figure skating’s governing body revised the results of the team competition at the 2022 Winter Olympics, a new fight about the outcome erupted on Monday. https://t.co/sCkpggL9B4

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 印度动物园有以战士、国王和神话人物的名字为动物命名的悠久传统。但在当前宗教关系紧张的情况下，有两只狮子的名字却惹上了官司。
item.description:
Indian zoos have a long tradition of naming animals after warriors, kings and mythological figures. But in the current climate of religious tension, two lions’ names have landed in court. https://t.co/co7RV5uUqi

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 去年夏天，在一场可疑的火灾后，歪屋被推倒。目前，当地政府已下令业主一砖一瓦地重新修建。
item.description:
The Crooked House was knocked down last summer after a suspicious fire. Local authorities have now ordered that the owners reconstruct the site brick by brick. https://t.co/XLCW2Ad987

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 克里姆林宫警告说，北约军队在乌克兰当地的干预将不可避免地导致俄罗斯与西方军事联盟之间的直接对抗，并将这种可能性描述为 "一个非常重要的新因素"。
item.description:
The Kremlin warned that the intervention of NATO troops on the ground in Ukraine would inevitably lead to a direct confrontation between Russia and the Western military alliance, describing the possibility as “a very important new element.” https://t.co/L62eBK9Evy

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 记录显示，去年外国食品制造商和进口商允许受铅污染的苹果酱进入美国并毒害了数百名幼儿，食品安全系统几乎在每一个层面都失灵了。作者：@By_Cjewett 和 @WillFitzgibbon
item.description:
Records show the food-safety system failed at almost every level last year as foreign food makers and importers allowed lead-tainted applesauce to enter the U.S. and poison hundreds of young children. By @By_Cjewett and @WillFitzgibbon https://t.co/PEllHaLvYO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 国际法院是联合国的最高司法机构，它罕见地在敌对行动仍在继续的情况下对一场备受关注的全球冲突进行了权衡。
item.description:
The International Court of Justice, the U.N.’s highest judicial body, is in the rare position of weighing in on a closely watched global conflict while hostilities are ongoing. https://t.co/cWGD5ykra3

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 是自负、普京还是军火交易？匈牙利在批准瑞典加入北约问题上拖拖拉拉的原因令许多人不解。
item.description:
Was it ego, Putin or an arms deal? The reasons for foot-dragging by Hungary over approving Sweden’s membership into NATO are perplexing many. https://t.co/9eSdU1zihg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 一些分析人士说，克里姆林宫的游戏计划使其能够逐步扭转乌克兰在阿夫迪耶夫卡的纵深防御，这是其控制整个顿巴斯的目标的一部分。
item.description:
The Kremlin’s game plan allowed it to gradually turn the tide against Ukraine’s deep defenses in Avdiivka, part of its goal to control all of the Donbas, some analysts say. https://t.co/7bhBNW2QLK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 莫斯科一家法院判处曾获 2022 年诺贝尔和平奖的俄罗斯人权组织 "纪念"（Memorial）联合主席入狱，理由是他反对乌克兰战争，"败坏 "了俄罗斯军队的声誉。
item.description:
A Moscow court sentenced the co-chairman of Memorial, the Russian rights group that was awarded the 2022 Nobel Peace Prize, to prison for “discrediting” Russia’s military by voicing his opposition to the war in Ukraine. https://t.co/DvZwi9MtLo

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 索马里已经被恐怖主义、饥饿和破坏性洪水搞得焦头烂额，现在又面临着更大的挑战：与邻国埃塞俄比亚开战的前景。
item.description:
Somalia, already upended by terrorism, hunger and devastating floods, faces an even bigger challenge: the prospect of war with a neighbor, Ethiopia. https://t.co/qAWtkdTNhI

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 伊朗和美国官员称，德黑兰担心引发与华盛顿的公开战争，已告知其支持的民兵组织减少对美国军事设施等目标的袭击。
item.description:
Tehran, wary of igniting open warfare with Washington, has told militia groups it backs to curtail assaults on targets such as U.S. military installations, Iranian and American officials say. https://t.co/iJHvLYS5fk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 27, 2024

item.title: 非洲各国政府正在努力遏制向中国出口驴皮，因为中国对一种传统药物的需求使运输和农业所需的动物面临危险。
item.description:
Los gobiernos africanos intentan frenar las exportaciones de piel de burro a China, donde la demanda de una medicina tradicional pone en riesgo a animales que son necesarios para el transporte y la agricultura. https://t.co/guqYIReGF4

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 26, 2024

item.title: 匈牙利议会批准瑞典成为北约新成员，使这个北欧国家扫清了阻碍其加入该军事联盟的最后障碍。
item.description:
Hungary’s Parliament approves Sweden as a new member of NATO, allowing the Nordic country to clear a final hurdle that had blocked its membership in the military alliance. https://t.co/lmqSDJMNJn

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 26, 2024

item.title: 英国足球队埃弗顿一直在努力抵御一场严重的金融风暴，在一次创纪录的点球判罚中，埃弗顿在英超联赛中排名垫底，但在上诉后，埃弗顿获得了一场小小的胜利。
item.description:
The English soccer team Everton, which has been trying to weather a serious financial storm, secured a modest victory when a record penalty that had sent it to the bottom of the Premier League standings was reduced on appeal. https://t.co/eY0taYTdUy

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 26, 2024

item.title: 阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼（Aleksei A. Navalny）的助手声称，这位俄罗斯反对派领导人在本月早些时候去世前，即将在与西方国家的囚犯交换中获释。
item.description:
Aides to Aleksei A. Navalny asserted that the Russian opposition leader had been on the verge of being freed in a prisoner exchange with the West before he died earlier this month. https://t.co/XMqxjypaKB

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 26, 2024

item.title: 据华盛顿大都会警察局称，周日下午一名男子在以色列驻华盛顿大使馆外自焚，警方正在对附近一辆可疑车辆进行爆炸物调查。
item.description:
A man set himself on fire outside the Israeli Embassy in Washington on Sunday afternoon and police were investigating a suspicious nearby vehicle for explosives, according to the Metropolitan Police Department in Washington. https://t.co/3F3W3gHTZE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 强奸、杀戮、酷刑：一份严酷的报告提供了新的证据，证明苏丹军方及其敌人准军事组织快速支援部队犯下了骇人听闻的暴行。
item.description:
Rape, killing, torture: A stark report offers new evidence of horrific abuses carried out by Sudan’s military and its enemy, the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces. https://t.co/D8s2tBxUlW
